method.name: Instance Based 3

reference.ref: D. W. Aha, D. Kibler, M. K. Albert, Instance-based learning algorithms, Machine Learning 6 (1991) 37-66

generalDescription.type: Preprocess Method. Data Reduction. Instance Selection. Incremental
generalDescription.objective: Reduce the size of the training set without losing precision or accuracy in order to a posterior classification
generalDescription.howWork: It starts with S initially empty, and each instance in T is added to S if it is not classified correctly by the instances already in S (with the first instance always added). IB3 is similar to IB2, but it uses the acceptability and dropability concepts.

parameterSpec.param: Distance Function: K-NN implements two distance functions. a) Euclidean with normalized attributed and b) HVDM (see paper D.R. Wilson, T.R. Martinez. Reduction Tecniques For Instance-Based Learning Algorithms. Machine Learning 38:3 (2000) 257-286.)
Confidence level for acceptance: Real value. Level of confidence for accepting an instance as important
Confidence level for dropping: Real value. Level of confidence for rejecting and instance as important
